name: Spherical space form conjecture
rephrased: A finite group can be realized as a symmetry group of the 3-sphere.
implication_form: If a finite group acts faithfully on the 3-sphere, then it is conjugate to a subgroup of the isometry group of the 3-sphere.
explained: The Spherical Space Form Conjecture, now a theorem proven primarily by Ludwig Bieberbach (1933, 1935), Wu-Hsiang Hsiang (1966), and Jeff Cheeger and Michael Gromov (1987), states that if a finite group G acts effectively on the 3-sphere S続 by isometries (i.e., preserving the standard Riemannian metric), then G is conjugate to a finite subgroup of the orthogonal group O(4) (or equivalently, of SO(4), since S続 is the group of unit quaternions). This means G must be a finite subgroup of the isometry group of S続. The theorem classifies all finite groups that can act faithfully by isometries on the 3-sphere.
related_conjectures: Geometrization Conjecture (now proven by Grigori Perel'man)
Elliptization Conjecture (a consequence of the Geometrization Conjecture for spherical 3-manifolds)
Bieberbach Conjecture (about the infinitesimal rigidity of crystallographic groups)
